metadata.title: CVE-2020-6824 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Initially, a user opens a Private Browsing Window and generates a passwordfor a site, then closes the Private Browsing Window but leaves Firefoxopen. Subsequently, if the user had opened a new Private Browsing Window,revisited the same site, and generated a new password - the generatedpasswords would have been identical, rather than independent. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 75.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
